hints.label: thm-lsi-implies-kl-convergence
hints.title: Exponential KL-Convergence via LSI
hints.content:
1865: :label: thm-lsi-implies-kl-convergence
1866: 
1867: If a Markov kernel $K$ with invariant measure $\pi$ satisfies a discrete-time LSI with constant $C_{\text{LSI}}$, then for any initial distribution $\mu_0$:
1868: 
1869: $$
1870: D_{\text{KL}}(\mu_t \| \pi) \le e^{-t/C_{\text{LSI}}} D_{\text{KL}}(\mu_0 \| \pi)
1871: $$

hints.label: proof-lsi-implies-kl-convergence
hints.content:
1876: :::{prf:proof}
1877: :label: proof-lsi-implies-kl-convergence
1878: **Step 1: Entropy contraction via LSI**
1879: 
1880: Let $\rho_t = d\mu_t/d\pi$ be the Radon-Nikodym derivative. The LSI states:
1881: 
1882: $$
1883: \text{Ent}_{\pi}(\rho_{t+1}) \le e^{-1/C_{\text{LSI}}} \text{Ent}_{\pi}(\rho_t)
1884: $$
1885: 
1886: But $\text{Ent}_{\pi}(\rho_t) = D_{\text{KL}}(\mu_t \| \pi)$.
1887: 
1888: **Step 2: Iteration**
1889: 
1890: Applying the LSI recursively:
1891: 
1892: $$
1893: D_{\text{KL}}(\mu_t \| \pi) \le e^{-t/C_{\text{LSI}}} D_{\text{KL}}(\mu_0 \| \pi)

hints.label: thm-main-kl-final
hints.title: KL-Convergence of the Euclidean Gas (Main Result)
hints.content:
1903: :label: thm-main-kl-final
1904: 
1905: For the N-particle Euclidean Gas with parameters satisfying the Foster-Lyapunov conditions of Theorem 8.1 in [06_convergence](06_convergence), the Markov chain
1906: 
1907: $$
1908: S_{t+1} = \Psi_{\text{total}}(S_t) = (\Psi_{\text{kin}}(\tau) \circ \Psi_{\text{clone}})(S_t)
1909: $$
1910: 
1911: converges exponentially fast to the quasi-stationary distribution $\pi_{\text{QSD}}$ in relative entropy:
1912: 
1913: $$
1914: D_{\text{KL}}(\mu_t \| \pi_{\text{QSD}}) \le e^{-t/C_{\text{LSI}}} D_{\text{KL}}(\mu_0 \| \pi_{\text{QSD}})
1915: $$
1916: 
1917: with LSI constant:
1918: 
1919: $$
1920: C_{\text{LSI}} = O\left(\frac{1}{\min(\gamma, \kappa_{\text{conf}}) \cdot \kappa_x}\right)
1921: $$
hints.raw_directive:

1915: $$
1916:

1918:

hints.label: rem-kl-tv-comparison
hints.title: Relationship Between KL and TV Convergence Rates
hints.content:
1937: :label: rem-kl-tv-comparison
1938: 
1939: The Foster-Lyapunov proof establishes TV convergence with rate $\lambda_{\text{TV}}$. The KL convergence rate is:
1940: 
1941: $$
1942: \lambda_{\text{KL}} = \frac{1}{C_{\text{LSI}}} = \Theta(\gamma \kappa_{\text{conf}} \kappa_x)
1943: $$
1944: 
1945: **Relationship:**
1946: - KL-convergence **implies** TV-convergence via Pinsker's inequality: $\|P_t - \pi\|_{\text{TV}} \le \sqrt{D_{\text{KL}}(P_t \| \pi)/2}$
1947: - The rates may differ: typically $\lambda_{\text{KL}} \le \lambda_{\text{TV}}$ (KL is stronger, may be slower)
1948: - For this system, both are $O(\gamma \kappa_{\text{conf}})$, suggesting **matched rates**
1949: 
1950: **Additional information from KL-convergence:**
1951: - Gaussian tail bounds via Herbst argument
